page.title: 06Local housing types.
page.content: Two main types of housing are found in our area.They are terraced houses and semi-detached houses. As much of the area is agricultural land there are also a number of farm houses scattered around. Many of the older terraced houses were built in parallel rows to provide homes for the coal miners working in the local pits around the turn of the century. The pits no longer survive but the houses do. (Our school is located on the site of an old colliery.) These terraced houses have no gardens, only back yards, but there are allotments near to all old terraced blocks. More recent (mid sixties and onward) terraced houses, built by the local council have a more informal layout with individual gardens, greens and walkways.
